Articles.Content:
I recently sent an email to Yahtzee from the Zero Punctuation game review series, describing KSP in detail. I\'m hoping that he picks up on the idea and reviews it!

And, I\'m back from a long hiatus! Hooray!
In b4 it backfires and he hates it.
Yeah, don\'t send a massively incomplete game to any reviewer, at all. Best-case scenario realistically is he doesn\'t post about it.
I don\'t think I\'ve ever seen him review an incomplete indie game. Or any indie game, for that matter. I don\'t see it happening. I think you\'d have had more luck with TotalBiscuit or the Yogscast.

Or any indie game, for that matter.

Didn\'t he review Minecraft?

Didn\'t he review Minecraft?

That\'s not really comparable-I\'d be surprised if you could find another indie game with more than a tenth of minecraft\'s player base.
Well yeah, but it is an indie game he reviewed that I forgot about. I still seriously doubt he\'ll review KSP, though.

That\'s not really comparable-I\'d be surprised if you could find another indie game with more than a tenth of minecraft\'s player base.

Uh. Yes it is. An Indie game is an Indie game. Simple as that.

By that simplest definition of indie, Skyrim was indie. Developed in-house, published in-house. Fits the bill. And I fully expect to get lots of 'bbbut-' replies to this.

Minecraft can just barely be called indie now, at best.

I\'d agree with Sordid that TB or the Yogscast would have better luck, but I suspect in its current state KSP would get buried among their collection of games that they didn\'t want to actually put up a video about.

Plus, the servers are struggling enough to provide updates and forums as it is, it seems, so if either of them -did- post a positive review, with the tens to hundreds of thousands of views any video they post gets ...

Yeah.
I found this game from my weekly \'find good games adventure\' were I go on trips through the internet trying to find something in the works. Preferably space stuff.

I found this through a comment on one of the youtube lets players I watch. It just so happened he was into astronomy and had shown orbiter and celestra on his channel. So I looked up Kerbal Space Program and found this. The next day I was teaching my friends how to play it!!!!
